content: Describe a serene lake using the words/style of Robert Frost.

Stillness lies upon the lake, a mirror held up to the sky,
Where clouds drift by in slow, lazy cadence, never to deny
The peacefulness that engulfs this scene, where nature takes its pace,
And time itself seems to stand still, in this tranquil, watery space.

The trees that line the shore stand tall, like sentinels of old,
Their leaves a whisper in the breeze, as if stories they were told
By the wind that rustles through their branches, carrying secrets from afar,
Of seasons past and memories made, near this serene, reflective bar.

A single boat drifts on the water, its oarsman lost in thought,
Perhaps contemplating life's profound, or just enjoying nature's taught
Lessons of patience and of grace, in this haven from the world's haste,
Where solitude is not a burden, but a gift, a balm to the soul's chaste.

Ducks glide upon the surface, their feathers dark against the light,
As sunlight dances on the water, casting patterns of delight,
A tapestry of gold and silver, ever-shifting, never the same,
A reminder that in constancy, change is the only absolute claim.

In the distance, mountains rise, their peaks touching the heavens above,
A backdrop to this idyllic scene, where earth and sky seem to love
Each other in silent embrace, a testament to nature's design,
Where every element finds its place, in harmony, in this lake's divine shrine.

So here, in this tranquil retreat, one can find solace and peace,
Away from the tumult of the world, where the heart can release
Its burdens and find rejuvenation, in the calm that surrounds,
A place where time stands still, and the soul can be unbound.
